ns0:StringWithMarkup.ns0:String: LD50 Anas platyrhynchos (mallard duck) male oral about 2000 mg/kg, 3 mo old /sample purity 92.5%
LD50 Phasianus colchicus (pheasant) male oral 611 mg/kg (95% confidence limit 351-1063 mg/kg) 3-4 moold /sample purity 92.5%/

LC50 Gammarus fasciatus (scud) 4300 ug/l (95% confidence 3400-5400 ug/l). Static bioassay without aeration, pH 7.2-7.5, water hardness 40-50 mg/l as calcium carbonate and alkalinity of 30-35 mg/l. /Technical material, 95%)

LC50 Salmo gairdneri (rainbow trout) 550 ug/l (95% confidence limit 410-730 ug/l), wt 1.1 g. Static bioassay without aeration, pH 7.2-7.5, water hardness 40-50 mg/l as calcium carbonate and alkalinity of 30-35 mg/l. /Technical material, 95%)

LC50 Ictalurus punctatus (channel catfish) 1600 ug/l (95% confidence limit 1480-1730 ug/l), wt 1.1 g. Static bioassay without aeration, pH 7.2-7.5, water hardness 40-50 mg/l as calcium carbonate and alkalinity of 30-35 mg/l. /Technical material, 95%)

LC50 Lepomis macrochirus (bluegill) 1300 ug/l (95% confidence limit 1180-1430 ug/l), wt 1.0 g. Static bioassay without aeration, pH 7.2-7.5, water hardness 40-50 mg/l as calcium carbonate and alkalinity of 30-35 mg/l. /Technical material, 95%)

LC50 Salmo clarki (cutthroat trout) 555 ug/l (95% confidence limit 415-742 ug/l), wt 2.2 g. Static bioassay without aeration, pH 7.2-7.5, water hardness 40-50 mg/l as calcium carbonate and alkalinity of 30-35 mg/l. /Crystal, 98.4%/

LC50 Salvelinus namaycush (lake trout) 490 ug/l (95% confidence limit 395-608 ug/l), wt 1.2 g. Static bioassay without aeration, pH 7.2-7.5, water hardness 40-50 mg/l as calcium carbonate and alkalinity of 30-35 mg/l. /Crystal, 98.4%/
LC50 Coturnix japonica (Japanese quail) oral (5 day ad libitum in diet) >5000 ppm, 14 days old no overt signs of toxicity to 5000 ppm /Technical grade, 98% active ingredient/
